reviews.review_msg: Can be confusing at times, but I found that her explanations are usually pretty good. Her exams are much harder than the practice she assigns so you're not really prepared for the questions that she asks on the midterm/final. It's an okay course though and she's very nice and good at explaining.

Dr. Braid is a kind professor, I can tell that she has a passion for teaching other people Genetics! However, her lectures can be (a little) convoluted at times and her assignments and practice exams aren't really on par with her actual exams. Still, I highly recommend taking her classes! She makes difficult topics easier for you to learn.

Although she is a nice person, her teaching is pretty confusing as she makes a lot of mistakes. For people who have done genetics in high school and take this course after a long time, it would get confusing without practice. Read and use the notes wisely. Doable with her for this course if you know how to study on your own.

she's super nice and sweet but she seems confused which confuses students. she says a lot of wrong things in which she confuses herself further confusing the students. we are not able to go over all material as she has to redo some slides several times due to errors. she posts lots of questions to help students though!!! she's nice though

The exams followed the problem sets and the problem sets were questions easily done after reading the notes. Sharon has great notes, just follow them and you'll be set. There was also a 5% bonus for attending class and answering clicker questions. Very interesting class and a great professor. Definitely recommended.
This course is fairly easy. Either go to class and study notes, or read the textbook for yourself. Dr. Gorski is a really nice prof too..!
